page.title: 11Canadians Visit Petworth
page.content: On Sunday April 28th 1985 a party of 250 Canadians belonging to the Toronto Scottish Regimental Association visited the town.The Toronto Scottish were a regiment of soldiers who were based in Petworth Park during the Second World War. When the Boy's School was bombed, they were the first people to begin digging the bodies out. They came on the fortieth anniversary of VE Day to remember those who were killed during the Second World War and to see the 'new' school (Petworth CE Primary School).
